thread.title: Ole Miss soccer streaks past UT
thread.title_full: Ole Miss soccer streaks past UT

title: Ole Miss soccer streaks past UT
text:
Ole Miss soccer streaks past UT News Sentinel staff 11:28 PM, Oct 23, 2015   Show Caption Next 
Tennessee and Ole Miss headed in opposite directions Friday night. 
Goals by Jessica Hiskey and freshman standout CeCe Kizer gave the No. 13 Rebels their fourth straight SEC soccer victory, 2-0 over the Vols before a crowd of 1,442 at Regal Soccer Stadium. 
With the loss, UT (7-4-5, 3-4-2 SEC) dropped back-to-back matches for the first time this season and fell to 0-3-1 against ranked teams. 
The Vols were able to control possession for most of the match and more than doubled Ole Miss (12-3-2, 6-3) in shots, 14-6. Nine different players recorded a shot for Tennessee, including two each for Rylie O'Keefe, Susan Ferguson, Emily Morrow, Anna Bialczak and Anna McClung. 
Ole Miss, meanwhile, didn't record its first shot until the 33rd minute. 
"I thought our first 20 to 25 minutes was very good â€¦ and then I thought we lost a little bit of composure, lost a little bit of an edge and that led to a corner kick and we didn't attack the ball," UT coach Brian Pensky said. 
The Rebels scored off that corner kick in the 34th minute. Hiskey rose above everyone in the middle of the box and headed one home past UT goalkeeper Julie Eckel for a 1-0 lead. 
Kizer scored in the 77th minute, beating Eckel from about 20 yards out with a perfect strike under the cross bar. 
UT will host Kentucky on Sunday (TV: SEC Network, 5 p.m.) and honor seniors Eckel, Ferguson and Gabby Santorio.
